eligibility:
The programme aims to equip students with the following: 1.    Develop a comprehensive understanding of social science research concepts. 2.    Foster scientific inquiry and critical thinking skills. 3.    Promote ethical values in research practices. 4.    Build effective communication and technology skills for professional success.
By the end of this program, students will be able to:
1.    Demonstrate in-depth content knowledge and its applications. 2.    Apply scientific inquiry and critical thinking to research. 3.    Uphold ethical standards in all research activities. 4.    Communicate effectively and leverage technology in professional settings.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Weekend Sessions: Pursue besides your work or internship during weekdays. Comprehensive Training: Master research methods and ethical practices. Real-world Impact: Solve social issues with evidence-based solutions. Expert Mentorship: Learn from experienced Researchers & Academicians. Networking Opportunities: Connect with industry leaders. Located in Bangalore, a research hub, provides growth opportunities.
what_learn: What you will learn? Advanced knowledge and Skills in qualitative and quantitative research methods Data collection Analysis, and interpretation using tools like Jamovi, R, or nvivo. Emphasizes interdisciplinary approaches to addressing social issues, ethical research practices, and critical thinking. Students gain practical experience in designing and conducting research, preparing them for roles in academia, policy-making, and social development sectors.
modules: Modules Basic statistics in social sciences Quantitative research methods Qualitative research methods Semester 1 Psychological tests and measures Academic writing Designing and proposing your research project Advances statistics in social sciences Psychometric methods Mixed methods research Semester 2 Jamovi/ R/ SPSS NVIVO Dissertation
career: Career prospects Academia, research organizations, NGOs, think tanks, policy-making bodies, and social development sectors. Graduates can work as Research Analysts Policy Advisors Social Researchers Program Evaluators Data Analysts
